item.title: Report X-2024100359
item.description:
Report X-2024100359

Identified by scraper @ 2024-10-05T09:31:04+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-10-02
  • City: FORT WORTH
  • State: TX
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Air
  • Carrier/Reporter: FEDERAL EXPRESS CORPORATION
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: On 10/2/2024 at approximately 1245, Dangerous Goods Administration received a call from Employee 393838 at the ramp facility in Fort Worth, reporting a dangerous goods spill. The shipment consisted of one fiberboard box that contained 4 glass bottles of petroleum crude oil. The package was damaged by mechanical equipment, resulting in one of the glass bottles breaking and spilling. There is no secondary containment or positive closure. The cushioning between the bottles was insufficient. The broken glass and damaged outer package were placed in a salvage drum for proper disposal and the remaining bottles were placed in a separate drum, awaiting an amended Shipper's Declaration for futher transport.

item.title: Report E-2024100147
item.description:
Report E-2024100147

Identified by scraper @ 2024-10-05T09:31:04+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-09-09
  • City: EL PASO
  • State: TX
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: XPO LOGISTICS, LLC
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 5500
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: At 0856 ET, XPO terminal LEP notified ERTS of a cargo release. It was reported approximately 1-gallon of Acetone Isobutyl Isobutyrate released from a total of (3)5-gallon metal pails due to improper loading. The release impacted trailer # 3173004. No storm drains or waterways are reported to be impacted by the release. Contractors containerized the (3) damaged pails of Acetone Isobutyl Isobutyrate product to (2) 55-gallon metal drums along with impacted rags. The waste was staged onsite for terminal personnel to manage.

item.title: Report E-2024100137
item.description:
Report E-2024100137

Identified by scraper @ 2024-10-05T09:31:04+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-09-05
  • City: HOUSTON
  • State: TX
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: XPO LOGISTICS, LLC
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: At 1130 ET, XPO notified ERTS of a cargo release at terminal LHO. It was reported that approximately 5 gallons of Endurabond B Cement/Tack 500 were released from (2) 5-gallon DMs due to improper loading. The release impacted the trailer floor. ERTS reviewed the SDS with the caller and determined that terminal personnel are capable of cleaning the release with PPE and oil dri available on site. 217000-1: 55-gallon DM contains (2) damaged pails of product, impacted oil dri. The drum was staged on site for terminal personnel to manage.

item.title: Report X-2024091936
item.description:
Report X-2024091936

Identified by scraper @ 2024-10-04T12:22:16+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-09-23
  • City: LAREDO
  • State: TX
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Rail
  • Carrier/Reporter: UNION PACIFIC RAILROAD CO
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 2500
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: During switching operations yard crew noticed JRTX 11206 seeping from the manway. After inspecting found manway swing bolts a total of (6) to be less than tool tight. Manway was opened and nozzle gasket was found to be in good condition. Manway was closed and tool tightened, and security seals were placed on manway & protective housing.

item.title: Report X-2024100147
item.description:
Report X-2024100147

Identified by scraper @ 2024-10-04T12:22:16+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-09-23
  • City: FORT WORTH
  • State: TX
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: FEDERAL EXPRESS CORPORATION
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: During sort operation at the AFWH location a fiberboard box was discovered with signs of a release. The fiberboard box contained two metal cans separated by a fiberboard divider, positive closure rings and packing paper for dunnage. The lid on one can was open spilling the contents. All contents were placed into a steel salvage package and a new declaration will be obtained for movement.

item.title: Report E-2024100025
item.description:
Report E-2024100025

Identified by scraper @ 2024-10-03T09:21:57+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-09-20
  • City: DALLAS
  • State: TX
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: R & L CARRIERS, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 5000
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: On September 20, 2024, one (1) 5-gallon pail of UN1263 was shipped with defective packaging and released approximately three (3) cups of product to the trailer interior. R+L Carriers retained Cura Emergency Services, LC who dispatched a crew from Lone Star Hazmat (LSH) to remediate the impacted site. LSH personnel utilized absorbents and hand tools to remediate the site. All impacted materials were containerized in one (1) 55-gallon drum and the damaged pail was containerized in one (1) additional 55-gallon drum.

item.title: Report E-2024090589
item.description:
Report E-2024090589

Identified by scraper @ 2024-10-02T09:14:40+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-09-06
  • City: DALLAS
  • State: TX
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: XPO LOGISTICS FREIGHT, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 4500
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: XPO-Logistics contacted ERTS regarding a release of LIMA-6, from a 275-gallon poly tote. The tote was crushed by other freight due to improper loading. A contractor was dispatched and observed a 0.5-gallon release isolated to the top of the tote. The contractor cleaned-up the release and performed a tote transfer. Four 55-gallon DFs were generated as waste for disposal containing impacted oil dry, impacted PPE, and cut-up tote pieces. XPO will manage all waste generated from the spill response. No storm-drains, waterways, or soil were involved in this incident.
